items.title: Andaman & Nicobar Islands
items.content: An archipelago of 572 idyllic islands in the Bay of Bengal, about 1,000 km from the mainland. The surrounding reefs are ideal for water sports.

items.title: Foothills of the Himalaya
items.content: Overlooked by the high peaks of the Himalayas, northern India is an area of spectacular beauty and peaceful tranquility, offering a rich diversity of religions and people.

items.title: Gujarat & Central India
items.content: The landscapes in this region range from the vast salt flats of Kutch, to dense jungles of Madhya Pradesh. An area of wonderful wildlife and great cultural centres.

items.title: Karnataka & Tamil Nadu
items.content: These states have all that a visitor could look for. Dramatic coastlines, dense forests and game reserves, magnificent ancient temples and modern urban centres.

items.title: Kerala
items.content: A rich cultural state and a mosaic of coconut groves and paddy fields, wide beaches and labyrinthine backwaters, verdant hills and rain forests

items.title: Kolkata & The East
items.content: The fascinating metropolis of Kolkata is the gateway to spectacular mountain vistas in Darjeeling and Sikkim, and Orissa’s magnificent temples and beaches.

items.title: Mumbai, Goa & The Deccan
items.content: Mumbai is the gateway to Goa’s idyllic beaches and Portuguese churches, the ancient caves and temples of Ajanta and Ellora, and the magnificent ruins of Hampi.

items.title: Rajasthan and The North
items.content: Maharajas, the Taj Mahal and the holy Ganges. No part of India is as rich in magnificent palaces and forts, monuments and temples.

items.title: The Lakshadweep Islands
items.content: An archipelago of 36 exquisite coral islands, with untouched beaches and verdant coconut groves, scattered off the Kerala coast in the Arabian Sea.
